channel.title: Anyone know where to get a CHEAP kindle? (Only want to read on it)
channel.description:
Well, I read A LOT and I really want a kindle to read on... My minimum is about $50....... Yeah, it's a bad price but that's about all I got :|.... Any help? Thanks guys.
Cheers!

item.title: Anyone know where to get a CHEAP kindle? (Only want to read on it)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It’s worth getting it officially from Amazon - their aftercare is amazing.

I broke mine through entirely my fault (leaned on it with my elbow in bed! haha) called up their tech support and explained the problem and asked if it was possible to purchase just the screen - they priority mailed me a new device instead, got it the very next morning. Free.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know where to get a CHEAP kindle? (Only want to read on it)
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m really surprised that no-one linked you to this post:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

This was around a month ago iirc, Moparisthebest was wanting to get his wife, srt8, an e-reader. You have all the information on that thread.

$62, 2 controllers the gun + game, coords and console

item.title: Anyone know where to get a CHEAP kindle? (Only want to read on it)
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

This is the cheapest kindle there is, $80.

amazon.com

Kindle – Released 2013 – Fact Sheet

The all-new Kindle - small, light, and perfect for reading. Enjoy 15% faster page turns, new darker fonts for easier reading, and new parental controls. Kindle reads like paper with no glare, even in ...


I have it because I got it as a gift, I’m too poor to be able to afford any books so I can’t use it much.
